By Inga Danko, Social Science Teacher

Senior interviews looked a little different this spring - We used zoom and google hangouts to interview our seniors - but we took the opportunity to connect with our seniors just like we always do. The staff were impressed with their poise and plans for their future, as well as how they have taken this time to reflect on how they have grown since Freshman year and especially during this quarantine.

As a class, I can say they have rolled with all of the changes and upheaval tremendously and I am very much looking forward to hearing more about what they accomplish. They have grit and perseverance and a level of flexibility that will serve them well.

As we move forward, being able to interview through an on-line platform will become increasingly important and this adaptation of our tradition was a great way for us practice this new way.

4th Grade Science Fair 2020

The Pecatonica Elementary School 4th Grade hosted a Science Fair Friday, March 6, 2020. Table after table displayed fascinating project boards for the community to learn about experiments such as; How Does Celery Change When Placed in Colored Waters? What brand of gum makes the biggest bubble? There were Exploding pop activities, diaper analysis projects, dish soap observations, and experiments involving cooling and heating of a variety of materials to track the changes, find out results, and log the data. All experiments including scientific methods and in conclusion the 4th grade scientists and teachers did an outstanding job!
Thanks for the great photos Mrs. Brandenburg!!!

post_text: On Wednesday, February 26, 2020 the 7th grade took a field trip to the ‘Mall of Life’. The CareerTEC Mall of Life is a life skill simulation event focusing on financial literacy during which students actively take part in making real-world adult decisions. In preparing for experience the students learned about balancing a checkbook and budgeting in their math class. When they arrived in Freeport, Illinois at the Career & Technical Education Consortium they were given a piece of paper with their career of choice and the corresponding “salary” for one month minus any student loan amount for the career choice they made. They were told if they were “single” or “married” and “if they had children”. They had to find a house, car, doctors,and get insurance. They had to buy groceries, food, utilities and electronics, and they could also get a pet or go on vacation. The Mall of Life offers a glimpse into the realities of a career, salaries, and the obligations of daily life. Thank you Mrs. Harvey for sharing the photos!

4th Grade has CPR/AED Training
The 4th graders at the Pecatonica Elementary School (PES) learned about CPR and AED training Wednesday, February 5, 2020. Heather Baker (Curriculum Director) brought in eight mannequins and an AED (Automated External Defibrillator) for the 4th Grade training session. Mrs. Baker explained about medical emergencies and when and how to administer Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and then students were able to practice in groups. They compressed to the rhythm of “Stayin Alive” and “Baby Shark”. If they performed a certain cadence on the CPR mannequin’s heart special indicator lights would turn red or green. The students got a workout! Next they learned where the building AED was located and how to use it. She answered many questions before a few volunteers had the opportunity to connect the device and use the AED safely on a mannequin. Thank you Mrs. Baker.

Jog-a-thon Winners Principal’s Luncheon at Culver’s
Mrs. Brockway and the Jog-a-thon winners in grades Kindergarten thru 4th joyfully loaded the bus on Wednesday, December 2019. They went to Culver’s in Winnebago in recognition of highest number of laps completed for the Pecatonica Elementary School Jog-a-thon. They were a lively group who were met by a friendly Culver’s staff and really enjoyed lunch and frozen yogurt! The money they helped raise will go to the elementary school for supplies and equipment. Thank you to all who participated or supported this event.
